name: Cenozoic
description: Early in the Cenozoic, following the K-Pg event, the planet was dominated by relatively small fauna, including small mammals, birds, reptiles, and amphibians. From a geological perspective, it did not take long for mammals and birds to greatly diversify in the absence of the dinosaurs that had dominated during the Mesozoic. Some flightless birds grew larger than humans.

name: Upper Paleolithic
description: Modern humans spread across the globe during the Upper Paleolithic, inventing new technologies and sophisticated art. At the beginning of the era, we shared the world with many other species of ancient humans. By the end, we were the only humans left.

name: Neolithic
description: In the Neolithic (or New Stone Age), humans developed agriculture. This allowed the first towns and cities to grow, and with it new and more complex social structures.

name: Bronze Age
description: The Bronze Age saw the use of bronze, along with writing and early urban societies. Though we use the dates for the ancient Middle-East, the Bronze Age started at different times in different regions.

name: Iron Age
description: The Iron Age was characterised by the predominance of iron in toolmaking. The dates given above are for the Middle-East; other areas developed iron-working later.

name: Classical Era
description: For much of the classical era, Eurasia was dominated by empires, such as the Roman, Persian, Mauryan and Han. The philosophy, religion and political structures developed by these civilizations provide the foundations of modern society.

name: Medieval
description: The Medieval Period (also known as the post-classical period) saw the integration of Eurasia, with goods and technology travelling throughout the continent. Religions such as Christianity, Islam and Buddhism developed and expanded.

name: Early Modern
description: The Early Modern period encompasses the Renaissance through to the French revolution. It saw the development of a global economy, linking the newly colonized Americas with older trade networks in Eurasia. New technologies, and in particular guns and cannons, spread through Eurasia, changing the nature of politics and warfare.

name: Modern
description: This is the period we live in! Starting with the industrial revolution and Napoleonic wars, the modern era has been one of rapid change.
